mechanics.outcome: A ward is created that protects up to 40,000 square feet of floor space to a height of 30 feet above the floor

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to enter warded area
mechanics.condition: Creature attempts to teleport into the area OR use portals (e.g., Gate spell) to enter the area
mechanics.outcome: Creature cannot teleport into the area or use portals to enter the area

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts planar travel into warded area
mechanics.condition: Creature attempts to access the area by way of the Astral Plane, Ethereal Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, or the Plane Shift spell
mechanics.outcome: Creature is prevented from accessing the area

mechanics.trigger: Creature enters warded area OR starts turn in warded area
mechanics.condition: Creature is of a type chosen by the caster (celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead) AND it's the first time it entered on this turn OR it's starting its turn there
mechanics.outcome: Creature takes 5d10 radiant or necrotic damage (caster's choice when casting spell)

mechanics.trigger: Creature enters warded area that would cause damage
mechanics.condition: Caster designated a password AND creature speaks the password as it enters the area
mechanics.outcome: Creature takes no damage from the spell

mechanics.condition: The spell's area would overlap with the area of another Forbiddance spell
mechanics.outcome: The spell cannot be cast in that location

mechanics.condition: Spell is cast every day for 30 days in the same location
mechanics.outcome: The spell lasts until it is dispelled, and the material components are consumed on the last casting

description_text: You create a ward against magical travel that protects up to 40,000 square feet of floor space to a height of 30 feet above the floor. For the duration, creatures can't teleport into the area or use portals, such as those created by the gate spell, to enter the area. The spell proofs the area against planar travel, and therefore prevents creatures from accessing the area by way of the Astral Plane, Ethereal Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, or the plane shift spell. In addition, the spell damages types of creatures that you choose when you cast it. Choose one or more of the following: celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. When a chosen creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature takes 5d10 radiant or necrotic damage (your choice when you cast this spell). When you cast this spell, you can designate a password. A creature that speaks the password as it enters the area takes no damage from the spell. The spell's area can't overlap with the area of another forbiddance spell. If you cast forbiddance every day for 30 days in the same location, the spell lasts until it is dispelled, and the material components are consumed on the last casting.
